snippet: The Senate president and House speaker said that they would not appeal a judge’s ruling, but they argued that redrawing boundaries too soon would disrupt the 2014 elections.
abstract: Florida House Speaker Will Weatherford and State Senate Pres Don Gaetz say Legislature will redraw boundaries for two congressional seats that judge ruled unconstitutional, but ask that new map not take effect until 2016 elections, arguing that change would throw 2014 elections into chaos.
lead_paragraph: The Senate president and House speaker said that they would not appeal a judge’s ruling, but they argued that redrawing boundaries too soon would disrupt the 2014 elections.

headline.main: Florida G.O.P. Seeks Delay on New Districts
headline.print_headline: Florida G.O.P. Seeks Delay on New Districts
